intro: Anchusa arvensis, commonly known as field forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of blue or violet flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Anchusa arvensis is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators.
